resources.string: Only people in the app can hear you.
Only people in the party can hear you.
CPU[%] and PSS[MiB] for SystemUX process
You now have longer battery life.
Choose apps from your library to automatically install on your Quest 2. You can skip this and install individual apps later.
Some of the apps you selected won\'t be installed.
To access Guardian settings, re-enable Guardian in the Developer section of Settings.
[FB ONLY] You are viewing the new Android implementation of settings. For more details visit the VR Settings XFN group.
You\'re using this device as an admin. Make sure to lock the controls when you\'re finished to avoid accidental changes.
All settings will be reloaded and any unsaved work may be lost.
The app requires the following permissions to be installed:
Any saved data or games may be permanently lost.
Running apps from unknown sources may put your account and device at risk.\10Our Platform Abuse Policy also prohibits piracy, illicit modding, cheating, and other unauthorized usage.
Get phone notifications on your headset.
Eligible apps you own will appear here. Just download the apps and launch them to get started! You may notice some of the apps work differently on your Quest.
Play Oculus Go and Gear VR Apps on Quest
%1$s will no longer be able to start a conversation with you and invite you to parties or events.
Are you sure you want to cancel this friend request?
Are you sure you want to remove %1$s as your friend on Oculus?
Add a short bio to tell people more about yourself.
This feature isn\'t working right now. Please check your Internet connection, or try again later.
Unable to Connect to the Internet
Take a photo or video to see it here.
You are in an active party
Couldn\'t block user. Please try again.
Log in with Facebook so you can chat, attend events and share your VR experience with friends.
Couldn\'t send request. Please try again.
Connect with people on Oculus so you can do fun activities together including multiplayer games and group chats.
Couldn\'t clear destination. Please try again.
Couldn\'t set destination. Please try again.
Couldn\'t send response. Please try again.
Couldn\'t launch app. Please try again.

People you block can no longer invite you to events or parties, start a conversation with you, add you as a friend or see things you post on your timeline. If you\'re friends, blocking someone will also unfriend them.
Your party has Oculus Rift users. When you launch into the selected application, Oculus Rift users won\'t be able to launch with you
Removing %1$s from this party will disconnect their audio from the other party members. %1$s will not be able to see or rejoin this party.
%1$s hasn\'t connected their account to Facebook so they can\'t access chats.
Are you sure you want to remove %1$s as your friend on Oculus?
Removing a friend has no effect on your Facebook account. If you\'re friends on Facebook, you will remain friends.
Please check your connection and try again
You can open the app now or wait for the leader to open it for everyone.
Waiting for the party leader to launch %1$s, %2$s.
Waiting for members to accept your invite.
Maximum number of people in destination reached.
Tell the party leader you are ready so they can open the app for everyone.
%1$s is selecting an app to Travel Together
Waiting for the leader to select a destination.
Select an app to launch with your party.
You can travel to the party’s location while you wait for others to join.
Travel to the party’s location to meet up with other people in the party.
Waiting for the party leader to select a destination to travel together.
Couldn\'t send invite. Please try again.
You were previously removed from this party and cannot rejoin. Start a new party to continue.
Couldn\'t join party. Please try again.
Couldn\'t leave party. Please try again.
Couldn\'t update party privacy. Please try again.
Couldn\'t start party. Please try again.
Party leader has traveled to %1$s. Now you can join them to play together.
This app doesn\'t support launching together.
Launch app to invite members to join you.
Waiting for party leader to launch app so you can join them to play together.
You traveled to %1$s. Your party members can join you to play together.
Couldn\'t cancel invite . Please try again.
Couldn\'t prepare app launch. Please try again.
Couldn\'t unfriend user. Please try again.
The developer has disabled streaming for this app.
The developer has disabled recording in this app.
The developer has disabled taking photos in this app.
There is not enough space on your device.
Saved data on your device and the cloud don\'t match. Would you like to use the data on this device, or the data on the cloud?
Your device failed to synchronize with the cloud. You can still launch the app, but it may result in lost data or progress.
After you pick up your controllers, please return to the center of your play area and select Continue.

To use this app, please pick up your controllers and select Continue.

Tip: Passthrough is a feature that lets you see your physical environment with your headset on. You can turn on passthrough now to find your controllers.
After you put your controllers down, please return to the center of your play area and select Continue.

To use this app, please put your controllers down and select Continue.

Tip: Passthrough is a feature that lets you see your physical environment with your headset on. You can turn on passthrough now to find a place to put your controllers down.
Nicely done. You’re ready to start exploring.
Use the universal menu to access apps, social features and settings.
This is where you’ll find your apps, including Oculus Store, Browser and more.
Welcome to Oculus Quest 2. Here’s how to navigate using your universal menu.
Welcome to Oculus Quest. Here’s how to navigate using your universal menu.
Thanks for sending a report. Your feedback helps make Oculus better for everyone.

By submitting, you agree to the Oculus Terms of Service, which supplements the Facebook Terms of Service. Learn how we use your data in the Oculus Data Policy, which suppliements the Facebook Data Policy.
Includes packages installed, memory usage, and breakdown
Sorry there an error occurred while submitting your report
Describe what went wrong, and how you encountered the problem.
Include this screenshot in your report
Add any photos or videos that can help us understand the problem.
File size limit exceeded. Please deselect an item to continue.
Updating to the latest software version may fix the problem you’re experiencing.
If you want to contact Oculus Support, submit a support ticket here.
If no controller is available, turn your head to look at your selection, then press the headset volume button.\10\10Common Issues
If no controller is available, point the cursor using your hand, then pinch with your index finger and thumb to select.\10\10Common Issues
Ensure controller battery has enough charge
Press both buttons simultaneously on the controller
The left controller has been successfully paired.
The left controller has been identified and is currently applying an update. Please wait a few moments for the controller to appear.
The right controller has been successfully paired.
The right controller has been identified and is currently applying an update. Please wait a few moments for the controller to appear.
Connection attempt will timeout in %1$d seconds...
Press and hold the highlighted buttons until a light starts blinking and you feel the controller vibrate.
Press both buttons simultaneously on one controller
Go to ocul.us/cast on a supported web browser like Google Chrome and enter the following code. This code is valid for the next minute.
Your Headset Is Ready To Cast
The connection with the browser was successful and your headset is now casting.
The application could not be launched. Please wait a few minutes and if the problem persists contact your administrator.
Admins may <u>log in</u> to attempt to resolve the issue.
Last checked for updates on %1$s at %2$s.
Last device sync time is unknown
Invite you to events or groups
%s\'s messages and calls may remain blocked.
%s will no longer be able to:
If you block %s\'s Facebook account, it won\'t automatically block them on Oculus.
If you\'re friends, blocking %s will also unfriend them.
If you want to be Facebook friends, you\'ll need to add %s after unblocking.
Unblocking %s will also unblock their messages and calls.
%s\'s messages and calls will remain blocked.
If you want to be Facebook friends, you\'ll need to add %s after unblocking.
Select a file to view details
Something went wrong. Please try again.
The visualizations will only appear within your Guardian boundary, and works up to 9 feet in front of you. This feature works best in rooms with ample lighting.
The visualizations will only appear within your Guardian boundary, and works up to 3 meters in front of you. This feature works best in rooms with ample lighting.
Now Guardian can show you a visualization of people, pets or objects that enter your boundary when you\'re in VR. Enable this feaure to help increase awareness of your physical surroundings.

You\'ll only see visualizations of things larger than the size of your hand. For example, you will see a visualization of a person who has entered your boundary, but not one of a small toy car. This feature will not show your surfaces like walls or mirrors, so please stay alert and keep your playspace free of intrusions.
Adjust the headset up and down against your face until the green lines are not blurry.
Press the trigger button on your controller to continue.
Move the slider left or right until the green lines are not blurry.
Check your Wi-Fi connection and try again.
Your Headset Is Not Connected to Internet
You have a new request to share what you are doing in VR with another device.
Don\'t show this warning dialog again
Share your VR view with another device.
Cast to your private link (oculus.com/casting) and view on a supported web browser, such as Google Chrome.
Cast this headset to a web browser (ocul.us/cast)
You\'re now showing your headset view on another device.
You\'re now connecting to another device.
Go to oculus.com/casting on your computer within 60 seconds. Be sure to use a supported browser like Google Chrome.
Your Headset is Ready to Cast
If you\'re in shared groups or rooms with this account, you\'ll still be able to see and communicate with each other. You can leave groups or rooms anytime.
Your Facebook account won\'t receive messages or calls from %s\'s Facebook account.
%s\'s messages and calls will also be blocked.
Failed to Block Messages and Calls
This account won\'t be blocked on Facebook. You may still be able to see %s\'s posts, comments and reactions on Facebook.
If you block messages and calls from someone\'s Facebook account, it won\'t automatically block them on Oculus.
If you\'re friends, blocking %s will unfriend them.
You\'ll need to unblock %s on Facebook to unblock messages and calls.
Failed to Unblock Messages and Calls
You won\'t receive anything that may have been sent during the block.
Your Facebook account may start receiving messages or calls from %s\'s Facebook account.
Press the to open your notifications
Open your notifications by using the Oculus button hand gesture.
Device storage is critically low. You have less than 500MB remaining.
Device storage is getting low. You have less than 2GB remaining.
To get phone notifications on your headset, go to your headset settings in the Oculus App and select Phone Notifications.
Set Up in the Oculus Mobile App
Access Rift apps while your Quest is plugged into your PC. You can enable/disable this from settings at any time
You\'ve returned to your Quest home menu. Plug your headset back into your computer if you want to re-enable Oculus Link.
You\'ve returned to your Quest home menu. Unplug and replug your headset if you want to re-enable Oculus Link.
You\'ve returned to your Quest home menu. Unplug and replug your headset if you want to re-enable Oculus Link.
Make sure the USB cable is plugged into your headset and into a USB 3 port on your computer. The Oculus app on your PC also needs to be running.
You\'ve returned to your Quest home menu. Unplug and replug your headset if you want to re-enable Oculus Link.
You\'ve returned to your Quest home menu. Unplug and replug your headset if you want to re-enable Oculus Link.
An error has occurred. You can start a new party or explore Oculus home.
The party you are trying to join is full. You can start a new party or explore Oculus home.
The party you are trying to join has ended or you can longer join it. You can start a new party or go back to where you were.
Press the Oculus button to show your universal menu.
Show your universal menu by using the Oculus button hand gesture. With your palm facing you at eye level, hold your thumb and index finger together.
Press and hold the Oculus button to reset your position.
Reset your position by selecting Settings from the universal menu, then select Reset View.
Error: Your photo was not saved to Oculus Gallery.
Success! You can find your photo in Oculus Gallery.
Receive notifications from your phone on your headset
Increase your display refresh rate to 120 Hz when requested by supported apps. This may affect battery usage, headset temperature, and the visual quality of some system features.
Help improve Oculus by reporting any problems you\'re experiencing
Quit the current app to check for updates
System Update is available. Make sure your device remains plugged in and powered on. Restart will be required.
Device must have at least 1 MB free to update.
Device must be at least %1$d%% charged to begin. Please plug in the device and charge to %1$d%% before starting the update.
Device must be plugged in to begin update. Please plug in the device before starting the update.
Tracking must be turned on in order to use this feature.
Manage the permissions for a specific app
Apps you own can access your username, profile picture, avatar and a list of your friends who own the same apps.
Manage which apps are allowed to use each permission type, such as microphone and storage.
There are no permissions for this application
Double press the Oculus button to use Voice Commands
Choose a voice to interact with
Use Voice Commands while playing games or in other apps
Manage your voice activation methods and privacy settings

When this is turned off, your voice interactions won’t be stored. Any previous voice interactions will still be stored—you can view, hear or delete them anytime. A trained team may review a sample to make our voice services smarter and more accurate. Learn More
View, listen to, and delete your Voice Commands here or on the Oculus mobile app. Learn More
Headset will turn off after a set period of inactivity

Automatically switch to hand tracking when you put your controllers down. If this setting is off, you’ll need to manually switch by using the Hand Tracking button in the Settings section of the universal menu.
Auto Switch Between Hands and Controllers
Headset will turn on when it detects your activity
Use your bluetooth connected mouse or trackpad in VR.
Pair a keyboard or gamepad with your device
Make the Menu button on your left controller behave as the Oculus button to pause apps and reset view
Move the Oculus button to your left hand and controller. The menu button will be on your right hand and controller.
Show a red dot when casting, livestreaming, or recording
Please restart your headset to save this change.

Place a virtual couch on your real couch so you can see and sit on it while in your virtual home environment. This feature allows you to use your couch as a separate seated play area in or outside of your Guardian boundary in VR.

Place a virtual desk on your real desk so you can see and use it while in your virtual home environment. This feature allows you to use your desk as a separate work area in or outside of your Guardian boundary in VR.
Keep in mind experimental features may stop working at any time. Please enable these features with caution, as they may increase your risk of injury or property damage.
Make Oculus and Menu buttons inactive when moving controllers quickly to prevent accidental presses during game play.

If you enable this setting, keystroke data will be stored on your device, and only aggregated modeling information from your device will be shared with Facebook to improve the keyboard experience for everyone.
Change the text size for the universal menu and supported Oculus apps
Open the universal menu within any app.
Looking down at an angle will make your Guardian boundary appear on the floor so you can see where you are in your play area.
This can’t be undone. You’ll need to set up Guardian again.
Remove all your Guardian boundary history
Change the color of your Guardian boundary. Please choose a color you can see clearly when your boundary appears in VR to alert you.

Guardian is an important safety feature that may only be disabled for content development. By selecting Acknowledge, you accept the risks inherent in disabling Guardian and agree to re-enable Guardian before any other use.
Play area boundaries may only be disabled for content development purposes

Use your hands as controllers. To support this feature, we analyze your hands to estimate your hand size and how they move. By enabling this feature, you agree to our collection and use of this data as detailed in our Hand Tracking Privacy Notice which explains how we collect and use this data.
Overrides the default hand tracking frequency set by application
Hand tracking, Oculus and Menu buttons, controller vibration

Low sensitivity shows you a precise outline of the person, pet or object that entered your boundary, but will take longer to appear. A high sensitivity means that you will see the intrusion faster, but it will look less precise.
Adjust the minimum coverage rate of the intruder regions projected to the image
Adjust the sensitivity of intruder\'s distance to the Guardian boundary
Lower floor height will show you more possible intrusions on the ground. A high floor height shows you fewer intrusions on the ground, and can filter out smaller people, pets or objects.
See a visualization when people, pets or objects enter your Guardian boundary when you are in VR
See a visualization when people, pets or objects enter your Guardian boundary when you are in VR.

If you enable this setting, keystroke data will be stored on your device, and only aggregated modeling information from your device will be shared with Facebook to improve the keyboard experience for everyone.
Access Rift apps while your Quest is plugged into your PC
Require long press to pause an app to prevent accidental presses during game play. This disables long press to reset view.
Long Press Oculus Button to Pause
Enables USB Connections via a confirmation dialog
Use multiple windows to manage your tabs while browsing
Please make sure your headset is connected to the internet, then give your headset and controllers to the other person so they can set up their account.
You already have app sharing enabled on another headset. To share apps on this headset, you’ll need to disable app sharing on the other headset first.
If you can’t access the other headset, visit the Oculus Support Center for more info.
We were unable to connect to the service. Please check your internet connection.
Share all of your apps from the Oculus Store with other people on this device
By enabling app sharing, all of your apps from the Oculus Store will be available to other people on this device only.
You can disable app sharing anytime from your device settings.
Add up to 3 other accounts and share eligible apps on this device. Enabling this feature will show Accounts under Settings.
You need to remove the accounts you added before you can disable this feature.
Share this device by adding up to 3 other people. Each person will need a Facebook account. Learn More
to your Quest so they can have their own apps and settings. They’ll need to create an Oculus account or sign into an existing one.
so other people can use your purchased apps on this device. They’ll need to install any shared apps, but the apps won’t take up more space.
by clicking your profile picture in the universal menu. Manage the other accounts and your unlock pattern in settings.
Get Started with Device and App Sharing
Something went wrong. Please try again later.
Please make sure your headset is connected to the internet to continue.
Something went wrong. Please check your connection and try again later.
This device is missing device identity. Please visit fburl.com/oc_device_identity for help.
Device identity error. Please contact customer support at support.oculus.com.
This will permanently remove your account from this device, including your installed apps, downloaded content and data stored on this device.
This will permanently remove the account from this device, including installed apps, downloaded content and data stored on this device.
Play a sound when you receive a new notification
Change your display to warmer colors, which may be easier on your eyes
To start tracking your calories and move minutes in VR, you’ll need to turn on the Move app.
See your Move stats while playing games in VR
Open the Browser while in App.
Choose where to look to see your Move overlay
See your keyboard in passthrough in VR
Double tap the left or right side of your headset to turn on passthrough at any time
Apps will show up here when you first receive notifications from them on your headset.
Choose which notifications you want to receive from.
Choose which notifications you want to receive, and when you’ll see them in VR.
Configure how phone notifications are received in VR
To get phone notifications on your headset, go to your headset settings in the Oculus app and select Phone Notifications.
Set Up in the Oculus Mobile App
[FB–Only] Try experimental pointer filters for hand tracking
If the Passthrough slider is set to full Passthrough, you won\'t need to use a Guardian boundary unless you enter an immersive experience. The slider is accessible in quick settings.
Skip Guardian Setup with Passthrough Slider
All feature settings reset to default
A lower controller distance means your controller will be closer to a boundary edge before you’re alerted.
A lower controller speed sensitivity means you’ll be alerted less during faster movement near a boundary edge.
A lower headset distance means your headset will be closer to a boundary edge before you’re alerted.
A lower headset speed sensitivity means you’ll be alerted less during faster movement near a boundary edge.
A lower Guardian sensitivity means you’ll be alerted less when moving faster and closer to a boundary edge. This may increase your risk of injury or damage.
See a real-time view of your physical environment when your headset gets close to the boundary edge.
Tracking must be turned on in order to use this feature.
See your bluetooth connected keyboard in VR.
Troubleshoot tracking problems by selecting the power frequency of outlets in your region
Detects your device’s movement and position in a play area
Set or remove your unlock pattern for this device
Future voice activity will be stored, transcribed and reviewed
You have no stored voice activity.
All voice activity will be deleted. You can review future voice activity later. You’ll still be able to use voice.
View, listen to, and delete your Voice Commands here or on the Oculus mobile app. Learn More
Activate Voice Commands with the “Hey Facebook” wake word. When this setting is enabled and your mic is on, Oculus will listen for the wake word. Restart required. Learn More
Press the Oculus button to show your universal menu.
Show your universal menu by using the Oculus button hand gesture. With your palm facing you at eye level, hold your thumb and index finger together.
People in this party will be able to see your Oculus activity independent of your Activity Setting.
Your public party will be visible in the Home Feed and anyone can join. As the party leader you can change the privacy settings.
Available for %1$d out of %2$d party members
Choose an App for This Party
Choose a Location for This Party
Anyone with the link can join this party
People can share the link with their friends through Messenger. You can update link-sharing at any time from the party settings.

People you block can no longer invite you to events or parties, start a conversation with you, add you as a friend or see things you post on your timeline. If you\'re friends, blocking someone will also unfriend them.
If you leave this party, you can still rejoin later while the party is active.
Are you sure you want to leave?
There are currently no active friends to invite.
Removing %1$s from this party will disconnect their audio from the other party members. %1$s will not be able to see or rejoin this party.
Are you sure you want to leave your current party? You won\'t be able to join this party again unless you are re-invited.
Changing this party from invite-only to open to friends will make it visible to anyone who is a friend of someone in the current party.
Changing this party from open to friends to invite-only will make it accessible only to people currently in the party or people you send invites to.
Removing a friend has no effect on your Facebook account. If you\'re friends on Facebook, you will remain friends.
You\'ll need to log in with Facebook to use parties and other social features on Oculus.
You blocked %3$d people in this party: %1$s, %2$s and %4$d others. You won\'t be able to hear each other.
You blocked one person in this party: %1$s. You won\'t be able to hear each other.
You blocked two people in this party: %1$s and %2$s. You won\'t be able to hear each other.
No one has joined this party yet
%1$s, %2$s and 1 other person are in this party
People in this party will be able to see your Oculus activity independent of your Activity Setting.
%1$s, %2$s and %3$d other people are in this party
%1$s is the only person in this party
This party does not currently have a location.
Someone you blocked may be in this party.
This party can only be joined with an invite.
People in this party can invite their friends.
Anyone with the link can join this party and share this link with their friends through Messenger. The party leader can turn off link-sharing at any time.
Someone you blocked or who blocked you is in this party. You will not be able to hear each other.

You are joining a public party.

People in the party will see your activity.
People in the party can travel together to share an experience.

When you join, your mic will be connected to the party where people will be able to hear you. You can mute your mic at any time.


By selecting Join Party you are agreeing to the Community Guidelines.
There is currently no one in this party.
People can find and join this party from a party member’s profile.
Friends can join this party without an invite
Anyone can share this link through Messenger. The link expires 6 hours after it has been created or once the party leader turns it off.
Anyone with the link can join this party
You\'ve been invited to join a party.
%1$s has invited you to join their party.
There are people in this party that you have blocked.

Stationary Guardian has a new, more comfortable Passthrough-based boundary. Now, when your headset gets close to the boundary edge, you\'ll see a real-time view of your physical environment instead of boundary lines in VR. Try it out by carefully leaning towards the boundary edge. You can turn this feature off anytime in Settings.

Stationary Guardian has a new, more comfortable Passthrough-based boundary. Now, when your headset gets close to the boundary edge, you\'ll see a real-time view of your physical environment instead of boundary lines in VR. You can turn this feature off anytime in Settings.

Keyboard tracking is only supported for flat surface movements and works best in a well lit room with the keyboard placed on a flat contrasting surface.\10\10To see your hands while typing, turn on Hand Tracking and Auto Enable Hands in Settings > Device > Hands and Controllers.
Press and hold the Oculus button to reset your position.
Reset your position by selecting Settings from the universal menu, then select Reset View.
